messages: cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:36): lol, there's a green spot in the middle of my screen and i couldn't for the life of me figure out where it was coming from. turns out it was the sun light on the back of the screen going through the apple icon but not the other parts of the screen
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:54): What's the easiest way to replicate git stash in mercurial?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:55): Where are all the mozilla people when you need them? :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:55): solves the problem by putting an opera logo over the apple logo
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (15:55): if I knew what git stash did...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:57): has no idea what git stash does

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:58): It saves the changes in your working tree (on a local branch as it happens) giving you a clean repositoty to pull into. It then lets you reapply those changes later on
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:58): http://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-stash.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:59): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: sounds like the nested repo provided by Merqurial Queues
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (15:59): hg qnew <some patch name> && hg qpop
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: So that's what I thought
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): But the situation is this
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:59): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: so I have a repo of my patch queue: http://hg.mozilla.org/users b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9_iki.fi/patches
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): I want to stash the local changes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): Pull and merge
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): and push the result
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): and then reapply the local changes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): I don't know how to do that with mq
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (16:00): make the patch, pop it off
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:00): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: don't you want to *rebase* the local changes while at it?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (16:00): pull, do the merge, push, hg qpush in the end
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): and my naive attempts gave error messages
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:00): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: have you enabled mq?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Sure, that somes for free with git :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): and I have added the local stuff to a patch
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): and I have pulled and merged
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): and now I am stuck
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): trying to commit the merge
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:01): (the local patch, that is)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: did you pull with hg pull --rebase otherrepo?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:02): No, but I'm starting to wish I had :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:02): well, there's your problem
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:02): so, first apply all the patches in mq you want to rebase
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:02): hg pull --rebase otherrepo
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:03): before you do, make sure you have a merge tool configured and you know how to use it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:03): Right, the problem is that it's not clear to me how to get from where I am to there without starting again
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:04): did you pull with mq patches applied or unapplied?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:04): Applied, it seems
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:05): That makes no sense
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:06): Oh I'm sonfused
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:06): Anyway I guess I can work it out
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:06): if you had mq patches applied and you pulled without --rebase, I have no idea what kind of mess you've gotten your repo into or how to recover
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:06): I never thought I would be prasing git for its usability
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (16:07): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: it's relatively fine unless you updated off of the mq series
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:07): Thanks for the help
